body: Since 9706d9a0, both `tox-bootstrapd` and `DHT_bootstrap` will crash when an UDP request on the listen port. Because the *logger* is disabled by default. Which causes bootstrap stopped at `toxcore/logger.c:106: logger_write: Assertion '!"NULL logger not permitted"' failed.`. Which means, any body can **make all the bootstrap nodes stop work** by just send an UDP request as, ```sh echo "123" | nc -u -w 1 example.org 33445 ``` --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/891)

comment_regular_data.body:
[![CLA assistant check](https://cla-assistant.io/pull/badge/signed)](https://cla-assistant.io/TokTok/c-toxcore?pullRequest=891)
All committers have signed the CLA.

Here is the related issue https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/879.

There was a workaround on [the bootstrap mailing list](https://lists.tox.chat/pipermail/bootstrap/2018-April/000003.html):

>2. Build Toxcore using cmake and add -DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=ON flag when 
running the cmake command, otherwise your bootstrap node will likely 
crash at run time. On how to build toxcore using cmake see 
https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/INSTALL.md.

I hoped @iphydf would make a proper fix for this really quick, but seeing how he did I can only guess that he doesn't have time for it, so a CMakeLists quick fix is appropriate for the time being, thanks for the PR.

Your fix works only if `BOOTSTRAP_DAEMON` is enabled, the system has `libconfig` installed and the system is not Windows. That's a bad fix. If I build `DHT_bootstrap` with `BOOTSTRAP_DAEMON=OFF`, my `DHT_bootstrap` will be crashing. You should do `add_definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)` unconditionally.

Also, have you tested the autotools build system, does the crash happen when building using it?

Hi @nurupo, 

> Also, have you tested the autotools build system, does the crash happen when building using it?

~~In short, no. But I can do it later. (This is my first commit, I have to finish some applications.)~~

Fixed by 8c77428

> Your fix works only if `BOOTSTRAP_DAEMON` is enabled, the system has `libconfig` installed and the system is not Windows. That's a bad fix. If I build `DHT_bootstrap` with `BOOTSTRAP_DAEMON=OFF`, my `DHT_bootstrap` will be crashing. You should do add `definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)` unconditionally.

Fixed by 74cd89e.

~~As I read from [*auto tests* source code](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/291a849a5a0afb4450bcd0d0c50b7aeccaac04f5/auto_tests/dht_test.c#L326-L328), I assume the logger should managed by programmer him/herself.~~

~~https: //github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/291a849a5a0afb4450bcd0d0c50b7aeccaac04f5/auto_tests/dht_test.c#L326-L328~~

~~To keep following the design, I choose to add `definitions(-DUSE_STDERR_LOGGER=1)` on `BOOTSTRAP_DAEMON=ON` only.~~

~~But if I made misunderstanding, I can do the change as you said.~~

Patch directly on CMakefile.txt & configure.ac causes logger's on in whole toxcore, including the libs.

This PR is running in wrong way. Give it up.

> See PR #892, #893
